Job Title: Market Research & Pricing Analyst

Location: Charlotte, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Description

We are looking for a professional Market Research & Pricing Analyst to take leadership of all aspects of market research projects and support fact-based decision making of our management to ensure the thriving of our business.

Reporting to Sr Director Client Success & Commercialization, the Market Researcher & Pricing Analyst will be part of the Commerce Enablement Solutions (CES) team, collaborating with various teams such as Marketing, UX/UI teams, Product, Operations, Sales, and Business Leaders. The primary focus of this role is to gather customer insights, conduct segmentation research, and provide actionable recommendations to enhance customer satisfaction and drive business growth.We are looking for a self-motivated professional with strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of market dynamics.To be successful, you must be able to:

 Establish strong relationships with business teams and work with other members of the research team and cross-functional teams to identify areas where segmentation can be applied effectively  Present research findings, insights, and recommendations to business stakeholders effectively and persuasively to provide a holistic perspective of the customer's point of view  Oversee end-to-end research projects, including proposal development, consultant selection, survey sampling, data collection, analysis, and reporting  Provide Persona Development: Create and communicate personas that describe segment behaviors and attitudes to aid in program and message 

RESPONSIBILITIES  : 

 Collect data on consumers, competitors and marketplace and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentations  Understand business objectives and design surveys to discover prospective customers’ preferences and overall market space opportunities  Lead and participate in qualitative and quantitative research studies to gather customer insights and feedback about interactions with the company's products, services, and overall brand perceptions  Compile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it  Perform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysis  Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations  Use online market research and catalog findings to databases  Provide competitive analysis on various companies’ market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation  Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct  Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices  Share research findings with senior leadership and executives  Use your findings to influence product and go-to-market roadmaps and teams to measure and improve Global Payments, Inc. and customer user value, usability, satisfaction, and delight  Manage vendor relationships with third party data and survey vendors 

QUALIFICATIONS  : 

 Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Social Sciences, or related disciplines.  Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative and qualitative research.  Proficiency in using statistical tools such as SPSS, Excel, R, and Looker.  Proficiency in using various research tools for surveying, focus groups, interviews, and secondary data analysis.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to apply different research methods and understand strengths and weaknesses of each design.  Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal.  Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines.  Collaborative team player with the ability to interact with diverse groups and levels within the organization.  Self-motivated and resourceful, with a passion for improving Customer Experience  Knowledge of marketing analysis, market research, and segmentation is desirable  Familiarity with data clustering, data collection, and proposal development is a plus 

Bonus Attributes:

 International experience a plus (especially in Europe)  Confidence in public speaking and presenting research findings  Experience in the payment, restaurant, retail industry, or SaaS business  Graduate degree with a focus in research methods or data analytics  Experience in scaling international products and working with remote/international team members 

Abilities

 Lead and manage customer research projects.  Ensure the research team is well-resourced and equipped with the necessary tools  Monitor research initiatives to ensure they align with objectives and milestones 

Note: This job description is a guide to the main duties and responsibilities of the Market Research position. Additional tasks may be assigned as per the needs of the organization and evolving strategies for the team's overall success.

The US base salary for this full-time position is Starting at $90,000 + benefits. Individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
